title: BufReader: incomplete reading into buffer.
body:
Incomplete reading into buffer.

**I tried this code**:

``` rust
use std::io::{BufReader, Read};

fn main() {
    let mut src = &vec![1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9][..];
    let mut buf: [u8;2] = [0;2];
    let mut reader = BufReader::with_capacity(3, src);
    reader.read(&mut buf).unwrap();
    assert_eq!(buf, [1,2]);
    reader.read(&mut buf).unwrap();
    assert_eq!(buf, [3,4]);  // failed, buf == [3,2]
}
```

**I expected to see this happen**: 

No error, because if I will directly read from src, then no error occurs:

``` rust
    let mut src = &vec![1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9][..];
    let mut buf: [u8;2] = [0;2];
    src.read(&mut buf).unwrap();
    assert_eq!(buf, [1,2]);
    src.read(&mut buf).unwrap();
    assert_eq!(buf, [3,4]);  // Ok!
```

So, I expect for the same behavior from BufReader.

**Instead, this happened**:

The `buf` is not completely filled.
